SwiftMessageFormat.name: MT506
SwiftMessageFormat.Description:
This message is sent either by the collateral giver, or its collateral manager, to the collateral taker, or its collateral manager, or by the collateral taker, or its collateral manager to the collateral giver, or its collateral manager .
It is used to provide the details of the valuation of both the collateral or the exposure or both.
This message is also used by the taker or the giver to request the cancellation of a previously sent collateral and exposure statement.
This message must not be used to claim collateral but may be used in support of a claim .
The message may also be used to:
a) re-send a message previously sent (Subfunction of the message is DUPL)
b) provide a third party with a copy of the message for information (Subfunction of the message is COPY)
c) re-send to a third party a copy of the message for information (Subfunction of the message is CODU).

Validation.Comment: Continuation Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): T97) :

Code.Name: LAST
Code.Description: This is the last page of a statement with more than one page.

Code.Name: MORE
Code.Description: This is an intermediate page of a statement which contains additional pages.

Code.Name: ONLY
Code.Description: This is the only page of a statement.

Validation.Comment: Reference must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
Function must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): T86) :

Code.Name: CANC
Code.Description: Message requesting the cancellation of a previously sent message.

Code.Name: NEWM
Code.Description: New message.

Validation.Comment: Subfunction, when present, must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): T85) :

Code.Name: CODU
Code.Description: Message is a copy to a party other than the account owner/account servicer, for information purposes and the message is a duplicate of a message previously sent.

Code.Name: COPY
Code.Description: Message is a copy to a party other than the account owner/account servicer, for information purposes.

Code.Name: DUPL
Code.Description: Message is for information/confirmation purposes. It is a duplicate of a message previously sent.

Validation.Comment: If Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: AFBA
Code.Description: French Banker's Association Agreement.

Code.Name: BBAA
Code.Description: British Banker's Association Agreement.

Code.Name: DERV
Code.Description: German Rahmenvertrag Agreement.

Code.Name: ISDA
Code.Description: International Swaps and Derivatives Association Agreement.

Code.Name: NONR
Code.Description: No information about the master agreement is available.

Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD . (Error code(s): T50) .
Number (Format Option B) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50) .
Time must be a valid time expressed as HHMMSS (Error code(s): T38) .
UTC Indicator must be a valid time expressed as HH[MM] (Error code(s): T39) .
Sign must not be used when UTC Indicator is equal to all zeroes (Error code(s): T14) .
If Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: BFWD
Code.Description: Any securities traded out beyond 3 days which include treasury notes, JGBs and Gilts.

Code.Name: CBCO
Code.Description: Exposures related to activity with central banks.

Code.Name: CCIR
Code.Description: Cross Currency Interest Rate Swap, indicating the exchange of fixed interest payments in one currency for those in another

Code.Name: COMM
Code.Description: Commodities trades eg futures and options on gold, silver, wheat.

Code.Name: CRDS
Code.Description: Trading of credit default swap.

Code.Name: CRPR
Code.Description: Combination of various types of trades.

Code.Name: CRSP
Code.Description: Cash lending/borrowing; letter of Credit; signing of master agreement.

Code.Name: CRTL
Code.Description: Opening of a credit line before trading.

Code.Name: EQPT
Code.Description: Trading of equity option (Also known as stock options).

Code.Name: EQUS
Code.Description: Equity swap trades where the return of an equity is exchanged for either a fixed or a floating rate of interest.

Code.Name: EXPT
Code.Description: Trading of exotic option eg. a non-standard option.

Code.Name: EXTD
Code.Description: Trading of exchanged traded derivatives in general (Opposite to Over the Counter (OTC)) .

Code.Name: FIXI
Code.Description: Trading of fixed income instruments.

Code.Name: FORW
Code.Description: FX trades with a value date in the future

Code.Name: FORX
Code.Description: FX trades in general.

Code.Name: FUTR
Code.Description: Related to futures trading activity.

Code.Name: LIQU
Code.Description: In support of settlement via an RTGS or other clearing system.

Code.Name: OPTN
Code.Description: Trading of option on Foreign Exchange.

Code.Name: OTCD
Code.Description: Over-the-counter (OTC) Derivatives in general eg. contracts which are traded and privately negotiated.

Code.Name: PAYM
Code.Description: In support of any type of cash settlement.

Code.Name: REPO
Code.Description: In support of a repurchase agreement transaction.

Code.Name: RVPO
Code.Description: In support of a reverse repurchase agreement transaction.

Code.Name: SBSB
Code.Description: Securities buy sell back.

Code.Name: SCIE
Code.Description: Exotic single currency interest rate swap.

Code.Name: SCIR
Code.Description: Single Currency Interest Rate Swap.

Code.Name: SCRP
Code.Description: Combination of securities related exposure types.

Code.Name: SHSL
Code.Description: Short sale exposure.

Code.Name: SLEB
Code.Description: Securities lending and borrowing.

Code.Name: SLOA
Code.Description: Secured loan.

Code.Name: SWPT
Code.Description: Option on interest rate swap.

Code.Name: TBAS
Code.Description: To be announced (TBA) related collateral.

Code.Name: TCRP
Code.Description: Combination of treasury related exposure types.

Code.Name: CCPC
Code.Description: Collateral covering the initial margin requirements for OTC trades

Validation.Comment: Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)

Name & Address (Format Option Q) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .

Proprietary code (Format Option R) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .
Number (Format Option B) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
Reference must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)

Name & Address (Format Option Q) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .

Proprietary code (Format Option R) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .
The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03,T40,T43) .
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .

Qualifier.Name: VALE
Qualifier.Description: Date/Time of Valuation of the Exposure

Qualifier.Name: VALC
Qualifier.Description: Date/Time of Valuation of the Collateral

Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50) .
Time must be a valid date expressed as HHMMSS (Error code(s): T38).

Validation.Qualifiers: AEXP, CORE, MITR, NRAD, PEVA, PRCV, PRHA, RADD, ROUN, TACR, TCHA, THRS, THRU, TPIN, TPOU
Validation.Comment: The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03,T40,T43) .

Validation.Qualifiers: AEXP, CORE, MITR, NRAD, PEVA, PRCV, PRHA, RADD, ROUN, TACR, TCHA, THRS, THRU, TPIN, TPOU
Validation.Comment: Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .
Reference must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
If Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: BFWD
Code.Description: Any securities traded out beyond 3 days which include treasury notes, JGBs and Gilts.

Code.Name: CBCO
Code.Description: Exposures related to activity with central banks.

Code.Name: CCIR
Code.Description: Cross Currency Interest Rate Swap, indicating the exchange of fixed interest payments in one currency for those in another .

Code.Name: COMM
Code.Description: Commodities trades eg futures and options on gold, silver, wheat.

Code.Name: CRDS
Code.Description: Trading of credit default swap.

Code.Name: CRPR
Code.Description: Combination of various types of trades.

Code.Name: CRSP
Code.Description: Cash lending/borrowing; letter of Credit; signing of master agreement.

Code.Name: CRTL
Code.Description: Opening of a credit line before trading.

Code.Name: EQPT
Code.Description: Trading of equity option (Also known as stock options).

Code.Name: EQUS
Code.Description: Equity swap trades where the return of an equity is exchanged for either a fixed or a floating rate of interest.

Code.Name: EXPT
Code.Description: Trading of exotic option eg. a non-standard option.

Code.Name: EXTD
Code.Description: Trading of exchanged traded derivatives in general (Opposite to Over the Counter (OTC)).

Code.Name: FIXI
Code.Description: Trading of fixed income instruments.

Code.Name: FORW
Code.Description: FX trades with a value date in the future.

Code.Name: FORX
Code.Description: FX trades in general.

Code.Name: FUTR
Code.Description: Related to futures trading activity.

Code.Name: LIQU
Code.Description: In support of settlement via an RTGS or other clearing system.

Code.Name: OPTN
Code.Description: Trading of option on Foreign Exchange.

Code.Name: OTCD
Code.Description: Over-the-counter (OTC) Derivatives in general eg. contracts which are traded and privately negotiated.

Code.Name: PAYM
Code.Description: In support of any type of cash settlement.

Code.Name: REPO
Code.Description: In support of a repurchase agreement transaction.

Code.Name: RVPO
Code.Description: In support of a reverse repurchase agreement transaction.

Code.Name: SBSB
Code.Description: Securities buy sell back.

Code.Name: SCIE
Code.Description: Exotic single currency interest rate swap.

Code.Name: SCIR
Code.Description: Single Currency Interest Rate Swap.

Code.Name: SCRP
Code.Description: Combination of securities related exposure types.

Code.Name: SHSL
Code.Description: Short sale exposure.

Code.Name: SLEB
Code.Description: Securities lending and borrowing.

Code.Name: SLOA
Code.Description: Secured loan.

Code.Name: SWPT
Code.Description: Option on interest rate swap.

Code.Name: TBAS
Code.Description: To be announced (TBA) related collateral.

Code.Name: TCRP
Code.Description: Combination of treasury related exposure types.

Code.Name: CCPC
Code.Description: Collateral covering the initial margin requirements for OTC trades

Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50) .
Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)

Name & Address (Format Option Q) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .

Proprietary code (Format Option R) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .
The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03,T40,T43) .
When Sign is present, Amount must not be zero (Error code(s): T14).
Sign must not be used when Number is equal to '0' (Error code(s): T14) .
If Data Source Scheme is not present and Qualifier is MICO, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: A001
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February, and provided that the interest period started on a 30th or a 31st. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th if the period started on a 30th or a 31st and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for US straight and convertible bonds.

Code.Name: A002
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and a 365-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th).

Code.Name: A003
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and the assumed number of days in a year in a way similar to the Actual/Actual (ICMA). Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). The assumed number of days in a year is computed as the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year.

Code.Name: A004
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 360-day year.

Code.Name: A005
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: A006
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and the assumed number of days in a year, ie, the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year. If the coupon period is irregular (first or last coupon), it is extended or split into quasi interest periods that have the length of a regular coupon period and the computation is operated separately on each quasi interest period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A007
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. However, if the last day of the maturity coupon period is the last day of February, it will not be assumed to be a 30th. It is a variation of the 30/360 (ICMA) method commonly used for eurobonds. The usage of this variation is only relevant when the coupon periods are scheduled to end on the last day of the month.

Code.Name: A008
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days of the interest period that fall on a normal year, divided by 365, added to the actual number of days of the interest period that fall on a leap year, divided by 366.

Code.Name: A009
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 365-day year (if the coupon payment date is NOT in a leap year) or a 366-day year (if the coupon payment date is in a leap year).

Code.Name: A010
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 366-day year (if 29 Feb falls in the coupon period) or a 365-day year (if 29 Feb does not fall in the coupon period). If a coupon period is longer than one year, it is split by repetitively separating full year sub-periods counting backwards from the end of the coupon period (a year backwards from a 28 Feb being 29 Feb, if it exists). The first of the sub-periods starts on the start date of the accrued interest period and thus is possibly shorter than a year. Then the interest computation is operated separately on each sub-period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A011
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for non-US straight and convertible bonds issued before 01/01/1999.

Code.Name: A012
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for the last day of February whose day of the month value shall be adapted to the value of the first day of the interest period if the latter is higher and if the period is one of a regular schedule. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28th Feb of a non-leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 29th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 29th, or to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. The 29th Feb of a leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. Similarly, if the coupon period starts on the last day of February, it is assumed to produce only one day of interest in February as if it was starting on a 30th Feb when the end of the period is a 30th or a 31st, or two days of interest in February when the end of the period is a 29th, or 3 days of interest in February when it is the 28th Feb of a non-leap year and the end of the period is before the 29th.

Code.Name: A013
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. It is a variation of the 30E/360 (or Eurobond basis) method where the last day of February is always assumed to be a 30th, even if it is the last day of the maturity coupon period.

Code.Name: A014
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period, excluding any leap day from the count, and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: OTHR
Code.Description: Other method than A001-A014 . See Narrative.

Validation.Comment: First Currency Code must be valid ISO 4217 currency codes (Error code(s): T52) .
Sign must not be used when Rate is equal to '0' (Error code(s): T14) .
Second Currency Code must be valid ISO 4217 currency codes (Error code(s): T52) .
The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03,T40,T43) .
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .

Option.Name: B
Option.Specification: (Identification Of Security)(Description Of Security) |(Description Of Security)

Validation.Comment: Quantity Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K36) :

Code.Name: AMOR
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, for example, a periodic reduction/increase of a bond's principal amount.

Code.Name: FAMT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, ie, the principal, of a debt instrument.

Code.Name: UNIT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as a number, eg, a number of shares.

Validation.Comment: Sign must not be used when Rate is equal to '0' (Error code(s): T14) .
Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50) .
The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03,T40,T43) .
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .
If Data Source Scheme is not present, Type must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K12) :

Code.Name: CALL
Code.Description: Call option.

Code.Name: PUTO
Code.Description: Put option.

Validation.Comment: In option A, Percentage Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K90):

Code.Name: DISC
Code.Description: Price expressed as the number of percentage points below par, eg, a discount price of 2.0% equals a price of 98 when par is 100.

Code.Name: PRCT
Code.Description: Price expressed as a percentage of par, as a rate.

Code.Name: PREM
Code.Description: Price expressed as the number of percentage points above par, eg, a premium price of 2.0% equals a price of 102 when par is 100.

Code.Name: YIEL
Code.Description: Price expressed as a yield.

Validation.Comment: In option B, Amount Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K90):

Code.Name: ACTU
Code.Description: Price expressed as an amount of currency per unit or per share.

Code.Name: DISC
Code.Description: Price expressed as a discount amount.

Code.Name: PREM
Code.Description: Price expressed as a premium.

Validation.Comment: Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52).
Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50) .
The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03,T40,T43) .
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .
Sign must not be used when Rate is equal to '0' (Error code(s): T14) .
Reference must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: BCOL
Code.Description: Either a Bank Guarantee or Letter of Credit.

Code.Name: CCOL
Code.Description: Collateral is cash.

Code.Name: SCOL
Code.Description: Collateral is securities.

Validation.Comment: If Data Source Scheme is not present, Status Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K25) :

Code.Name: PEND
Code.Description: Collateral instruction is pending. Settlement at the instructed settlement date is still possible.

Code.Name: SETT
Code.Description: Collateral was settled.

Validation.Comment: The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03,T40,T43) .
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .
Sign must not be used when Number is equal to '0' (Error code(s): T14) .
If Data Source Scheme is not present and Qualifier is MICO, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: A001
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February, and provided that the interest period started on a 30th or a 31st. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th if the period started on a 30th or a 31st and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for US straight and convertible bonds.

Code.Name: A002
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and a 365-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th).

Code.Name: A003
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and the assumed number of days in a year in a way similar to the Actual/Actual (ICMA). Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). The assumed number of days in a year is computed as the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year.

Code.Name: A004
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 360-day year.

Code.Name: A005
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: A006
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and the assumed number of days in a year, ie, the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year. If the coupon period is irregular (first or last coupon), it is extended or split into quasi interest periods that have the length of a regular coupon period and the computation is operated separately on each quasi interest period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A007
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. However, if the last day of the maturity coupon period is the last day of February, it will not be assumed to be a 30th. It is a variation of the 30/360 (ICMA) method commonly used for eurobonds.The usage of this variation is only relevant when the coupon periods are scheduled to end on the last day of the month.

Code.Name: A008
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days of the interest period that fall on a normal year, divided by 365, added to the actual number of days of the interest period that fall on a leap year, divided by 366.

Code.Name: A009
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 365-day year (if the coupon payment date is NOT in a leap year) or a 366-day year (if the coupon payment date is in a leap year).

Code.Name: A010
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 366-day year (if 29 Feb falls in the coupon period) or a 365-day year (if 29 Feb does not fall in the coupon period). If a coupon period is longer than one year, it is split by repetitively separating full year sub-periods counting backwards from the end of the coupon period (a year backwards from a 28 Feb being 29 Feb, if it exists). The first of the sub-periods starts on the start date of the accrued interest period and thus is possibly shorter than a year. Then the interest computation is operated separately on each sub-period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A011
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for non-US straight and convertible bonds issued before 01/01/1999.

Code.Name: A012
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for the last day of February whose day of the month value shall be adapted to the value of the first day of the interest period if the latter is higher and if the period is one of a regular schedule. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28th Feb of a non-leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 29th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 29th, or to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. The 29th Feb of a leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. Similarly, if the coupon period starts on the last day of February, it is assumed to produce only one day of interest in February as if it was starting on a 30th Feb when the end of the period is a 30th or a 31st, or two days of interest in February when the end of the period is a 29th, or 3 days of interest in February when it is the 28th Feb of a non-leap year and the end of the period is before the 29th.

Code.Name: A013
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. It is a variation of the 30E/360 (or Eurobond basis) method where the last day of February is always assumed to be a 30th, even if it is the last day of the maturity coupon period.

Code.Name: A014
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period, excluding any leap day from the count, and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: OTHR
Code.Description: Other method than A001-A014 . See Narrative.

Validation.Comment: First Currency Code must be valid ISO 4217 currency codes (Error code(s): T52) .
Sign must not be used when Rate is equal to '0' (Error code(s): T14) .
Second Currency Code must be valid ISO 4217 currency codes (Error code(s): T52) .
The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03,T40,T43) .
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .

Option.Name: B
Option.Specification: (Identification Of Security)(Description Of Security) |(Description Of Security)

Validation.Comment: Quantity Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K36) :

Code.Name: AMOR
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, for example, a periodic reduction/increase of a bond's principal amount.

Code.Name: FAMT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, ie, the principal, of a debt instrument.

Code.Name: UNIT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as a number, eg, a number of shares.

Validation.Comment: Sign must not be used when Rate is equal to '0' (Error code(s): T14) .
Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50) .
Narrative must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26) .
If Data Source Scheme is not present, Place Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K94) :

Code.Name: FUND
Code.Description: Source is a fund (transfer agent, fund itself, etc.)

Code.Name: LMAR
Code.Description: Source is the market.

Code.Name: THEO
Code.Description: Source is a theoretical value based on the market yield.

Code.Name: VEND
Code.Description: Source is an external vendor.

Validation.Comment: The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03,T40,T43) .
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .
Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: CLNT
Code.Description: Call/Notice deposit.

Code.Name: FIXT
Code.Description: Fixed Term deposit.

Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50) .
Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22) :

Code.Name: GCOL
Code.Description: Collateral is a bank guarantee.

Code.Name: LCOL
Code.Description: Collateral is a documentary credit.

Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50) .
In option B, if Data Source Scheme is not present, Date Code must contain the following code (Error code(s): K98) :

Code.Name: OPEN
Code.Description: There is no expiry date.

Validation.Comment: Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)

Name & Address (Format Option Q) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .

Proprietary code (Format Option R) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .
The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03,T40,T43) .
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .
Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)

Name & Address (Format Option Q) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .

Proprietary code (Format Option R) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26) .

Qualifier.Name: TCOP
Qualifier.Description: Total Collateral Held Value of Page

Validation.Comment: The number of digits following the comma must not exceed the maximum allowed for the specified currency (Error code(s): C03,T40,T43) .
When Sign is present, Amount must not be zero (Error code(s): T14) .
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52) .

fieldvalidation.name: U08
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "Invalid syntax, format, code word in tag 119(Validation Flag),or field tag 119 is missing"

fieldvalidation.name: C1
fieldvalidation.comment: C1 If the message is a cancellation, ie, Function of the Message (field 23G) is CANC, then subsequence A2 (Linkages) must be present at least once in the message, and in one and only one occurrence of A2, field :20C::PREV must be present; consequently, in all other occurrences of A2, field :20C::PREV is not allowed (Error code(s): E08).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "If the message is a cancellation, ie, Function of the Message (field 23G) is CANC, then subsequence A2 (Linkages) must be present at least once in the message, and in one and only one occurrence of A2, field :20C::PREV must be present; consequently, in all other occurrences of A2, field :20C::PREV is not allowed."

fieldvalidation.name: C2
fieldvalidation.comment: C2 In sequence A, if field :20C::SCTR is not present, then field :20C::RCTR is mandatory, otherwise field :20C::RCTR is optional (Error code(s): E68).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In sequence A, if field :20C::SCTR is not present, then field :20C::RCTR is mandatory, otherwise field :20C::RCTR is optional."

fieldvalidation.name: C3
fieldvalidation.comment: C3 In sequence B, if field :19B::TEXA is not present, then field :19B::TCRL is mandatory, otherwise field :19B::TCRL is optional (Error code(s): C04).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In sequence B, if field :19B::TEXA is not present, then field :19B::TCRL is mandatory, otherwise field :19B::TCRL is optional."

fieldvalidation.name: C4
fieldvalidation.comment: C4 In each occurrence of sequence D, the presence of subsequences D1, D2 and D3 depends on the value of field :22H::COLL//<Indicator> (Error code(s): E83).
fieldvalidation.formula: If($value == "BCOL", D.D1.$size == 0 && D.D2.$size == 0 && D.D3.$size > 0, If($value == "CCOL", D.D1.$size == 0 && D.D2.$size > 0 && D.D3.$size == 0, If($value == "SCOL", D.D1.$size > 0 && D.D2.$size == 0 && D.D3.$size == 0, true)))
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In each occurrence of sequence D, the presence of subsequences D1, D2 and D3 depends on the value of field :22H::COLL//Indicator."

fieldvalidation.name: C5
fieldvalidation.comment: C5 In each occurrence of subsequence D2, the presence of field :98A::TERM depends on the value of field :22H::DEPO//<Indicator> (Error code(s): E85).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In each occurrence of subsequence D2, the presence of field :98A::TERM depends on the value of field :22H::DEPO//Indicator."

fieldvalidation.name: C6
fieldvalidation.comment: C6 In each occurrence of subsequence D3, if field :22H::BCOL//LCOL is present, then field :98B::EXPI//OPEN (ie, Qualifier = EXPI, Data Source Scheme not present and Date Code = OPEN) is not allowed, otherwise field :98B::EXPI//OPEN is optional (Error code(s): E72).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In each occurrence of subsequence D3, if field :22H::BCOL//LCOL is present, then field :98B::EXPI//OPEN (ie, Qualifier = EXPI, Data Source Scheme not present and Date Code = OPEN) is not allowed, otherwise field :98B::EXPI//OPEN is optional."

fieldvalidation.name: C7
fieldvalidation.comment: C7 In each occurrence of subsequence A1, if field :22F::AGRE is not present, then field :70C::AGRE is mandatory, otherwise field :70C::AGRE is optional (Error code(s): E71).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In each occurrence of subsequence A1, if field :22F::AGRE is not present, then field :70C::AGRE is mandatory, otherwise field :70C::AGRE is optional."

fieldvalidation.name: C8
fieldvalidation.comment: C8 In subsequence B1, fields 16R and 16S may not be the only fields present. If both fields 16R and 16S are present, then at least one of the other fields of the same subsequence must be present (Error code(s): D13).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In subsequence B1, fields 16R and 16S may not be the only fields present. If both fields 16R and 16S are present, then at least one of the other fields of the same subsequence must be present."

fieldvalidation.name: C9
fieldvalidation.comment: C9 The user header of the message (block 3) is mandatory and must contain a valid code in the Validation Flag field 119 ( {3:{119:xxxx}} ). This code must be identical to the code contained in field :22a::COLA//xxxx (Exposure Type Indicator) in sequence A of the message content (text block 4) (Error code(s): C94).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "The user header of the message (block 3) is mandatory and must contain a valid code in the Validation Flag field 119 ( {3:{119:xxxx}} ). This code must be identical to the code contained in field :22a::COLA//xxxx (Exposure Type Indicator) in sequence A of the message content (text block 4)."

fieldvalidation.name: C10
fieldvalidation.comment: C10 In each occurrence of subsequence D1, the presence of field :70C::RATS depends on the presence of field :94B::RATS as follows (Error code(s): E60).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In each occurrence of subsequence D1, the presence of field :70C::RATS depends on the presence of field :94B::RATS."

fieldvalidation.name: C11
fieldvalidation.comment: C11 If sequence C is not present, sequence D is mandatory. If one or more occurrence of sequence C is present, sequence D is optional.(Error code(s): C21).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "If sequence C is not present, sequence D is mandatory. If one or more occurrence of sequence C is present, sequence D is optional."

fieldvalidation.name: FC1-35B-A
fieldvalidation.comment: FC1-35B-A ISIN is used at the beginning of Identification of Security (Subfield 1) and must be composed of uppercase letters only (Error code(s): T12).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: $value + " is not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c"

fieldvalidation.name: FC1-35B-B
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "Not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c";

fieldvalidation.name: FD1-35B-A
fieldvalidation.comment: FD1-35B-A ISIN is used at the beginning of Identification of Security (Subfield 1) and must be composed of uppercase letters only (Error code(s): T12).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: $value + " is not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c"

fieldvalidation.name: FD1-35B-B
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "Not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c";
